text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you how I make my homemade waffles
they're simple they're quick and they
use ingredients that you probably
already have on hand so let's go over
them so we can get started you're gonna
need some all-purpose plain flour some
whole milk or you can even use 2% melted
unsalted butter one egg vanilla extract
a little baking powder pinch of salt and
tiny bit of sugar
those are your ingredients and now you
know I mean these are super simple it's
their everyday ingredients so we're
gonna get straight into making the
waffles
now in this loophole where I had flour
I'm going to just mix together my flour
my baking powder my salt and my sugar
just to get them mixed together but
there are no lumps of one thing and not
the other in the batter and now if
you're anything like me making waffles
in a Monday or Tuesday morning is just
it doesn't happen you know gonna leave
early for work there's not enough time
to make something like this but the
weekends I just love to cook and bake on
weekends and breakfast is one of those
things that I just love to do when I
have time so in the big bowl I'm putting
on my wet ingredients which is just the
milk be melted butter egg and just a
drop of vanilla extract now the amount
that these waffles will make is going to
vary based on your waffle iron which I'm
going to preheat mine just a little bit
and so I can't tell you how many these
are gonna make so if you want fyren's
really big it's gonna make less if it's
really small then it'll make more so I'm
doing it just mixing my wet ingredients
to get them all incorporated now we're
going to add in our dry ingredients and
I'm just gonna mix them to incorporate
them but I don't want to over mix them
otherwise I'm not gonna get a very
fluffy waffle it'll be way too dense so
just mix it for like ten seconds if it's
a got a little lump here in there that's
perfectly fine a lumpy batter will be a
fluffy batter when it
see your waffles or pancakes or anything
like that now what I'm gonna do is I'm
gonna set this aside for about five to
ten minutes just to let it rest and the
meantime I'm gonna grab my waffle iron
and get it preheated my batters been
sitting for five minutes and I preheated
my waffle iron now like I said I can't
tell you how long it takes to cook and I
can't tell you how long how much they
make it depends on your waffle iron so
make sure you read the manufacturer's
instructions well just so you know like
what temperature to put it on and all
that kind of stuff so what I'm gonna do
now is I'm going to brush it with a
little bit of butter because I want to
make sure nothing sticks or you can use
some vegetable oil if you don't want to
use butter just brush it all the way
through and this is a silicone spatula
silicone pastry brush it's not gonna
burn so don't worry about that and now I
know that mine takes about like a third
of a cup of batter for each batch so
that's why I use a measuring cup and
then you put it in the middle and you
just scoop it to the side use a tiny
tiny bit more and then just put the lid
on and when the little button turns
green then I know that that batch is
done and then I'll move on to the next
one last one and look where it's going
right on my plate now like I said mine
made about four or five big ones
actually one two three four five big
ones um it's gonna bury you know because
of the waffle iron but these are just so
delicious I like a little maple syrup
drizzled over the top don't like a whole
ton of it or I love love love waffles
with like berry compote like a real
fresh homemade berry compote or I like
it with Nutella you name it if it's a
good waffle I'll eat it however you give
it to me this one right here mmm that's
so delicious
so delicious and if you want to make
these on the weekend make a batch of
them just like so wrap them individually
in plastic wrap and then in the morning
pop them in a toaster and you have fresh
homemade waffles it does like that
you'll need to buy the frozen ones at
the supermarket because you can make
them fresh freeze them yourself and
they'll taste ten times better I'm going
back in for another bite I hope you
enjoy spending time with me go to WWE
and the kitchen knock off to get this
incredible simple recipe and I'll see
you next time bye
[Music]
